Keep the translation vector at (0.0, 0.0, 0.0) so the origin is at the center of the base sketch. Building the base sketch: Create the first face of the coordinate system and draw a closed loop shape with four lines. 1. Line 1: Start Point: (0.0, 0.0), End Point: (0.75, 0.0) 2. Line 2: Start Point: (0.75, 0.0), End Point: (0.75, 0.668) 3. Line 3: Start Point: (0.75, 0.668), End Point: (0.0, 0.668) 4. Line 4: Start Point: (0.0, 0.668), End Point: (0.0, 0.0) Scaling the base sketch: Apply a sketch scaling of 0.75 to the entire base sketch. This will reduce the overall size of the sketch and ensure the final dimensions match the specified design parameters. Transforming the 2D sketch into a 3D model: Set the Euler angles for rotation of the 2D sketch plane and the translation vector to those specified in the coordinate system. This will orient the base sketch properly and position it for the upcoming extrusion. Extruding the 2D sketch: Extrude the base sketch along its normal by a distance of 0.5273 units. The `extrude_depth_opposite_normal` value is set to 0.0 to ensure material is not removed from this section. Summarizing Part 1 properties: This part has a length of 0.75 units, a width of 0.75 units, and a height of 0.5273 units, resulting in the desired three-dimensional geometric shape resembling a pyramid. Upon completion, Part 1 will be ready for further operations to integrate it with subsequent parts as defined in the "operation" field.</description>

prompt: <description>**Instructions for Part 1** Construct a rectangular prism with a cylindrical hole in the center. Begin by creating a new coordinate system at the origin with no rotation. For the first face of the sketch, create a loop with the following lines: - Line 1: Start Point (0, 0), End Point (0.75, 0) - Line 2: Start Point (0.75, 0), End Point (0.75, 0.2143) - Line 3: Start Point (0.75, 0.2143), End Point (0.75, 0.4286) - Line 4: Start Point (0.75, 0.4286), End Point (0, 0.4286) - Line 5: Start Point (0, 0.4286), End Point (0, 0.2143) - Line 6: Start Point (0, 0.2143), End Point (0, 0) For the second face of the sketch, create a loop with a circle at the center of the first face: - Circle: Center (0.5136, 0.2143), Radius 0.1179 Scale the sketch by a factor of 0.75. Transform the scaled 2D sketch into 3D Sketch using the euler angles and translation vector provided in the coordinate system. Extrude the 2D sketch along the normal direction by 0.0643 units to create the 3D model. **Instructions for Part 2** Construct a three-dimensional rectangular prism with a slightly tapered top. Begin by creating a new coordinate system at the origin with no rotation but with a translation vector of (0, 0, 0.0643). For the sketch, create a loop with the following lines: - Line 1: Start Point (0, 0), End Point (0.0643, 0) - Line 2: Start Point (0.0643, 0), End Point (0.0643, 0.4286) - Line 3: Start Point (0.0643, 0.4286), End Point (0, 0.4286) - Line 4: Start Point (0, 0.4286), End Point (0, 0) Scale the sketch by a factor of 0.4286. Transform the scaled 2D sketch into 3D Sketch using the euler angles and translation vector provided in the coordinate system. Extrude the 2D sketch along the normal direction by 0.4286 units to create the 3D model. Join the extruded sketch with the previously constructed part. The final shape is a rectangular prism with a cylindrical hole in the center and a tapered top. The prism is white and the hole is black. The prism is positioned at an angle and the hole is perpendicular to the prism's surface. The prism is centered in the image. The dimensions of the rectangular prism are 2 units by 4 units by 6 units and the cylindrical hole has a diameter of 1 unit. The tapered top has dimensions equal to half the length of the sides of the rectangular prism.</description>
